hazards.description: Leakage current or applied part contact causes patient shock
hazards.harm: Ventricular fibrillation, cardiac arrest, burns, death
common_causes: Excessive leakage current through applied part
Single fault condition (e.g., mains voltage on applied part)
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1 compliance testing (Clause 8 - Leakage currents)
Type BF or CF applied part classification (for cardiac applications)
Means of patient protection (MOPP) ≥2 for Type CF
Leakage current limits: Normal <100μA, Single Fault <500μA (Type BF)
Dielectric strength testing at 1500V AC for 1 minute
Protective earth resistance <0.2Ω
Warnings about use in wet environments

hazards.description: Operator contact with live parts or enclosure under fault conditions
hazards.harm: Electric shock, burns, involuntary muscle contraction
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1 Clause 8.6 - Enclosure leakage current limits (<100μA normal)
Means of operator protection (MOOP) ≥1
IP rating for enclosure (IP21 minimum per IEC 60529)
Instructions for pre-use inspection of power cord
Service access interlocks or warnings
Ground fault circuit interrupter (GFCI) recommendations

hazards.description: Device emits electromagnetic energy that interferes with other equipment
hazards.harm: Malfunction of nearby life-support equipment (ventilators, monitors, pacemakers)
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1-2:2014 EMC testing (emissions per CISPR 11)
Group 1 Class B limits for emissions (residential environment)
Radiated emissions <30 dBμV/m at 3m (30 MHz - 1 GHz)
Conducted emissions on mains <66 dBμV (150 kHz - 30 MHz)
Instructions for minimum separation distances from other equipment
Warnings about use near implanted devices (pacemakers, ICDs)

hazards.description: Device malfunctions due to electromagnetic interference from external sources
hazards.harm: Incorrect output, loss of essential performance, patient injury
common_causes: Electrosurgical units in same operating room
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1-2:2014 EMC testing (immunity per IEC 61000-4 series)
Radiated immunity testing at 10 V/m (80 MHz - 2.7 GHz)
ESD immunity ±8 kV contact, ±15 kV air discharge
Electrical fast transient (burst) immunity ±2 kV on mains
Surge immunity ±2 kV line-to-line on mains
Warnings about use near strong EM sources
Instructions for risk management when immunity limits exceeded

hazards.description: Software defect causes device to fail to perform intended function
hazards.harm: Loss of monitoring, incorrect therapy delivery, delayed diagnosis
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Functional failure - Loss of function
typical_controls: IEC 62304 software lifecycle compliance (Class B or C based on risk)
Software hazard analysis per ISO 14971
Unit testing, integration testing, system testing per IEC 62304 Clause 5.5-5.7
Static code analysis tools (MISRA compliance for embedded)
Cybersecurity controls per FDA premarket guidance (2023)
Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for SOUP components
Post-market software maintenance and update procedures

hazards.description: Software calculates or displays incorrect data leading to clinical error
hazards.harm: Misdiagnosis, inappropriate therapy, patient injury or death
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Functional failure - Incorrect output
typical_controls: Algorithm validation testing with known reference datasets
Clinical validation study to verify accuracy
IEC 62304 software unit testing for calculation modules
Usability testing per IEC 62366-1 to prevent use errors
Instructions for verification of output reasonableness
Warnings about limitations of algorithms (e.g., population applicability)
Independent third-party algorithm verification (if applicable)

hazards.description: Unauthorized access to device or patient data
hazards.harm: Loss of confidentiality, device malfunction due to malicious code, ransomware
common_causes: Outdated operating system or libraries with known vulnerabilities
typical_controls: FDA premarket cybersecurity guidance (2023) - Secure by Design
Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for vulnerability tracking
Encryption for data at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.3)
Authentication and authorization controls (NIST SP 800-63B)
Penetration testing and vulnerability scanning
Secure software update mechanism with code signing
Post-market vulnerability management and patching procedures
Instructions for network security configuration

hazards.description: Device enclosure or applied part reaches unsafe temperature
hazards.harm: First to third degree burns on patient or operator
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1 Clause 11 - Temperature limits
Applied part contact temperature <41°C for prolonged contact (>1 min)
Accessible surface temperature <48°C under normal use
Thermal testing under worst-case conditions (max ambient, blocked vents)
Thermal cutoff or overheat protection
Warnings about surface temperature during/after use
Ventilation requirements in IFU

hazards.description: Battery depletion, leakage, or fire during device operation
hazards.harm: Loss of device function, chemical burns, fire, explosion
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1 Clause 11.8 - Internal electrical power sources
UN 38.3 testing for lithium batteries (if >20 Wh)
Battery management system (BMS) for overcharge/overdischarge protection
Low battery alarm or indicator (IEC 60601-1 Clause 6.4.8)
Instructions for battery replacement schedule
Warnings about battery disposal per RCRA
Thermal protection for lithium batteries (max 60°C cell temperature)

hazards.description: Exposure to ionizing or non-ionizing radiation beyond safe limits
hazards.harm: Radiation burns, tissue damage, increased cancer risk, eye injury
common_causes: Excessive X-ray dose in imaging devices
Laser eye exposure in optical devices
Ultrasound thermal or mechanical index exceeds limits
typical_controls: IEC 60601-2-54 for X-ray imaging (dose limits, AEC performance)
IEC 60601-2-22 for surgical lasers (Class 3B or 4 controls)
IEC 60601-2-37 for ultrasound (TI <6.0, MI <1.9 for fetal)
Radiation safety interlock systems
Instructions for ALARA (As Low As Reasonably Achievable) principle
Operator training on radiation safety
Dosimetry monitoring for ionizing radiation
Laser safety eyewear requirements in IFU

hazards.description: Motors, actuators, or robotic components malfunction causing unintended motion
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Mechanical hazards - Moving parts
common_causes: Software error in motion control algorithm
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1 Clause 12 - Accuracy of controls and instruments
Redundant position sensors with comparison monitoring
Software safety architecture per IEC 62304 Class C
Emergency stop button (IEC 60601-1 Clause 15.4.4)
Force/torque limiting to prevent crush injuries
Motion testing with intentional faults injected
Warnings about operator vigilance during motion
Clinical risk mitigation procedures (e.g., timeout verification)

hazards.description: Device fails to generate or user fails to perceive critical alarm
hazards.harm: Delayed response to patient deterioration, injury or death
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Functional failure - Incorrect alarm
common_causes: Alarm drowned out by ambient noise
Alarm fatigue from excessive false alarms
typical_controls: IEC 60601-1-8 Alarm system requirements (priority, pause limits, backup)
Usability testing per IEC 62366-1 to validate alarm perception
Alarm priority classification: High (red), Medium (yellow), Low (cyan)
Minimum sound pressure levels: High 65 dB, Medium 55 dB at 1m
Visual alarm signals in addition to audible
Default alarm settings cannot be disabled for critical parameters
Instructions for alarm setting and testing procedures
Post-market surveillance for alarm-related adverse events

severity_scale.1: Negligible - No injury or health effect
severity_scale.2: Minor - Temporary injury requiring first aid
severity_scale.4: Critical - Permanent impairment or life-threatening injury
severity_scale.5: Catastrophic - Death or irreversible severe injury
